thread.title: Sergio Agüero’s agent says striker is intent on staying at Manchester City | Football | The Guardian
thread.title_full: Sergio Agüero’s agent says striker is intent on staying at Manchester City | Football | The Guardian

author: Jamie Jackson
title: Sergio Agüero’s agent says striker is intent on staying at Manchester City | Football | The Guardian
text:
Sergio Agüero is intent on being at Manchester City next season and is willing to compete with Gabriel Jesus for a starting berth, according to his agent, Hernán Reguera.
Jesus makes mark as Leicester hurtle towards drop – Football Weekly Extra Read more 
The striker was dropped by Pep Guardiola, the head coach, for Wednesday night’s 4-0 win at West Ham United , with the 19-year-old Jesus taking his place and scoring his first goal for the club since a £27m move from Palmeiras last month.
Agüero has previously been dropped twice before by Guardiola, when City lost at Barcelona 4-0 in the Champions League in October and when Burnley were beaten 2-1 in January.
Yet when contacted on Thursday Reguera stated Agüero is content at City. “Yes, he is very, very happy – he will be there next season.”
Asked if Agüero had any issue with potentially having to compete for his place with Jesus, Reguero replied: “No problem.”
It is understood that Guardiola still views Agüero as first choice and that the 28-year-old has much to offer City for the foreseeable future.
